TopicTitle: Cloud configurations for Outer Planets Mod [Last Update: 2015.09.23]

Articles.Content:
**Clouds for Outer Planets Mod**

Sigma88 has joined the project and made a ModuleManager config that allows us to combine all configs into one download. The config can determine which CloudMod you have installed and apply only the corresponding configs. If you have any of [Sigmas Mod Expansions](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112095) installed, the config will adjust the color, rotation and auroras to match it. 

**Download:**

[KerbalStuff](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/1065/OPM%20clouds)

> 
> MEGA: 
> [OPMclouds-0-6.zip](https://mega.co.nz/#%21eh1RyAzD%21pvmcA13daCykRta7DNk4dMsaxdhmpOPFwE2FVe5aqtw)
> TinyUpload: [OPMclouds-0-6.zip](http://s000.tinyupload.com/?file_id=00197402593230458154)
> 
> 

**Installation:**

Delete older versions!

Open the zip-file and copy the 'GameData' folder into the KSP directory. 

**Dependency:**

[Outer Planets Mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280)

[ModuleManager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219)

Supported are the following CloudMods (click on the image for imgur-album):

 [EVE-7-4](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905)

 [![7mUMnF3.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/7mUMnF3.jpg)](https://imgur.com/a/jc5Ww)

 [KSPRC](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76972)

[![cf9aBVN.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/cf9aBVN.jpg)](https://imgur.com/a/Q8axW)

 [AVP-EoO](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/89138) 

[![j3x7SFt.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/j3x7SFt.jpg)](https://imgur.com/a/KYtYq)

[AVP-Int](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102145)

[![P8hVZc3.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/P8hVZc3.jpg)](https://imgur.com/a/MRNfH)

(If you use AVP-Int, make sure to install 'clouds for Eve & Jool'). 

[AVG](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126611)

(pics will follow)

> 
> ########## 0-8
> 
> - Added support for AVG's Pack
> 
> - Empty cloud\_layer\_packs are now removed
> 
> - Reworked Neidon for all packs
> 
> - New texture for Neidon added
> 
> - Configs for Thatmo and Nisse added
> 
> - Reworked Auroras for KSPRC and AVP-EoO
> 
> - alpha1.dds replaced with alpha1.png (for volumetric clouds)
> 
> ########## 0-7
> 
>  - Surface dust for all non-atmospheric bodys.
> 
> - Glow-effects for Pluron and Khato.
> 
> - Cloud rings for Urlum.
> 
> - DDS-textures.
> 
> - MoonGlow for EVE is installed by default again.
> 
> ########## 0-6
> 
>  - All configs combined into one pack (thanks sigma ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)).
> 
>  - All configs moved to 'GameData/OPMclouds'.
> 
>  - Reduced altitude of the Glow-layers.
> 
>  - Reworked Sarnus.
> 
>  - Adjusted rotation-speeds.
> 
>  - Reduced opacity for Auroras with KSPRC.
> 
> - Small texture called 'alpha1.png' has been added (4x2 pixel). It's used only with EVE since there is no comparable texture available by default.
> 
>  - An optional OPM-EVE-MoonGlow.cfg has been added.
> 
> - Download from KerbalStuff is now available.
> 
> ########## 0-5
> 
> All:
> 
> - Urlums colors adjusted to look more like the OPM texture.
> 
> - Urlums CloudLayer heights increased to reduce Z-fighting. 
> 
> - Glow effects on the GasGiants are 'thicker' to create a smooth transition from planet to space (since there is no AA with OpenGL).
> 
> - Tekto config replaced with the original Tekto config from OPM 1.5.5 for AVP-Interstellar to match the concept better. Some small adjustments but it's mostly the original file.
> 
> EVE-pack:
> 
> - Removed glow-effects on moons to match stock bodys.
> 
> KSPRC:
> 
> - Reworked old glow-effects on moons to fit the KSPRC-style better.
> 
> - Added glow-effects to Hale, Priax and Tal.
> 
> AVP-EoO:
> 
> - Added glow-effects to Hale, Priax and Tal.
> 
> AVP-Int:
> 
> - Added glow-effects to Hale, Priax and Tal.

The config file of each CloudMod is used for the determination. Don't make changes to these files or rename them unless you know what you are doing. 

**Tekto Lightning:**

The lightning on Tekto is compatible to ALL visual packs (EVE, KSPRC, AVP, BA) but one texture from AVP-Interstellar is required (see installation below for details). 

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/8Ar4A)

Download from MEGA: [OPM-All-TektoLightning-0-1](https://mega.co.nz/#%21K5dSVK6Z%21P-B0VpOZCUeGfvYrX1imdXTgUQTCt6ObKrhhSYxhSuQ)

Download from TinyUpload: [OPM-All-TektoLightning-0-1](http://s000.tinyupload.com/?file_id=35500339315598935901)

Installation: Install [OPM](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280) and the cloud-mod of your choice. Download [AVP-Int](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102145) and open the zip file. Navigate to *'4th Step - Optional Features\Extra Features (make sure KSP can run first)\29MB Lightning (Kerbin, Duna, Eve, Laythe)\Step 2\GameData\BoulderCo\Clouds\Textures*' and copy the *'lightning.png*' to *'KSP/GameData/BoulderCo/Clouds/Textures'*. Copy the 'GameData' folder from OPM-All-TektoLightning-0-1.zip into the KSP directory.

**Notes:** No auroras. No glow effects on moons.

Installation: Install [OPM](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280), [EVE](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905) and [AVP-EoO](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/89138). Download [AVP-Int](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102145) and open the zip file. Navigate to *'4th Step - Optional Features\Essential Features (still optional though)\Clouds for Eve & Jool\11MB 2K (if you crash with 4K)\GameData\BoulderCo\Clouds\Textures'* and copy 'altostratus.png' and 'cirrus.png' to '*GameData\BoulderCo\Clouds\Textures*'. Copy the 'GameData' folder from OPM-Ulti-config-0-3.zip into the KSP directory.

Notes: Without the additional textures there will be NO clouds around the GasGiants.

> 
> **Notes for all packs:**
> 
> - All packs add glow effects around the GasGiants and some of the moons. These configs are seperated from the clouds and can be easily deleted (see Customization below for details). Same is true for auroras (except EVE).
> 
> - All configs are designed with and for OpenGL. 
> 
> **Customization:**
> 
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > Navigate to '*GameData/BoulderCo/Clouds*' and delete 'OPM-X-Auroras.cfg' (X = used pack, for example 'EVE', 'KSPRC', 'Int', etc.)
> 

> 
> Navigate to '*GameData/BoulderCo/Clouds*' and delete 'OPM-X-GasGiantsGlow.cfg' (X = used pack, for example 'EVE', 'KSPRC', 'Int', etc.)

> 
> Navigate to '*GameData/BoulderCo/Clouds*' and delete 'OPM-X-MoonGlow.cfg' (X = used pack, for example 'EVE', 'KSPRC', 'Int', etc.)

rbray89 for [EVE](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905).

Astronomer for [AVP-EoO](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/89138) and [AVP-Int](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102145).

Proot for [KSPRC](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76972).

Thesonicgalaxy for [BA](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/77523).

Avera9eJoe for [AVG](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126611).

sarbian for [GCMonitor](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92907) and [ModuleManager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219).

Thomas P. for [Kopernicus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649).

KGas, Inc for inspiration on the BA config.

Starbuckminsterfullerton for his Tekto Lightning idea and config.

Whovian for the ring-suggestion.

**Special thanks to Sigma88 for support and inspiration!** 

Have a look at all his awesome stuff right [**here**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112095-WIP-0-90-Sigma-Mod-Expansions)

**Special thanks to CaptRobau for support and advice!**

I think you are talking about the Glow-effects around Ovok since it does not have any atmosphere. Tried that but the layer is perfectly round and I can't make it oval (if you or someone else knows how to do that please tell me). There would only be glow on the Sarnus-facing side of Ovok and the glow slightly changes the surface color of the body. The result looks really bad because you clearly see where the layer goes beneath the surface. 

Another approach would be to make the glow layer big enough to surround the entire body but that looks ridiculous.

Use a mod switcher like [JSGME](http://forums.ubi.com/showthread.php/674497-JSGME-Generic-Mod-Enabler-Forums). It works for KSP and makes loading/unloading mods a lot easier and you wouldn't have to copy the KSP folder all the time. Just install the JSGME.exe into KSP\_win and have it generate a mod folder. Then you can put the mods in there (the order is MODS>CloudConfig1>GameData>...). With JSGME.exe you can then move mods into GameData or out of it. It's why I have dozens of mods and even more WIP versions of OPM on only one instance of KSP.

> 
> thank you again ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> you are doing really a great job!

Then you can put the mods in there (the order is MODS>CloudConfig1>GameData>...). With JSGME.exe you can then move mods into GameData or out of it. It's why I have dozens of mods and even more WIP versions of OPM on only one instance of KSP.

I should really do a PSA with info on how to use that program, because it's a waste of time if people think that they can only manually manage their mods through multiple instances of KSP or other time-consuming practices.

> 
> Use a mod switcher like [JSGME](http://forums.ubi.com/showthread.php/674497-JSGME-Generic-Mod-Enabler-Forums). It works for KSP and makes loading/unloading mods a lot easier and you wouldn't have to copy the KSP folder all the time. Just install the JSGME.exe into KSP\_win and have it generate a mod folder. Then you can put the mods in there (the order is MODS>CloudConfig1>GameData>...). With JSGME.exe you can then move mods into GameData or out of it. It's why I have dozens of mods and even more WIP versions of OPM on only one instance of KSP.
